articles.author: Alexander Cornwell, Parisa Hafezi, Steve Holland
articles.description: Iran and Israel targeted each other with airstrikes early on Saturday after Israel launched its biggest-ever offensive against its longtime foe in a bid to prevent it from developing a nuclear weapon.
articles.title: Israel, Iran launch more barrages as Israel aims to wipe out Tehran's nuclear program

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The latest round of U.S.-Iran nuclear talks scheduled for Sunday in Muscat will not take place, Omani Foreign Minister Badr Albusaidi said on X on Saturday. Oman has been mediating the talks.
articles.title: Sunday's U.S.-Iran nuclear talks cancelled, Oman says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Authorities said the gunman was impersonating a police officer and escaped after exchanging fire with police. Gov. Tim Walz called the shootings politically motivated assassination.
articles.title: Minnesota state lawmakers shot, one killed, search underway for suspect, state governor says

articles.author: Idrees Ali, Phil Stewart, Jeff Mason
articles.description: Nationwide protests against President Donald Trump, tensions in the Middle East amid Israel's strikes on Iran and expected rainy weather in Washington on Saturday could dampen spirits at a military parade on the U.S. Army's 250th anniversary, set to feature tanks on the streets and aircraft flying overhead.
articles.title: Protests, Middle East - and bad weather - may rain on Trump's military parade

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Moscow did not receive any of its war dead from Kyiv, Russian state media reported.
articles.title: Russia and Ukraine exchange prisoners of war, but Moscow received no war dead, Russia says

articles.author: Sumit Khanna, Sudipto Ganguly
articles.description: Doctors were working overtime to gather dental samples from the deceased to run identification checks and DNA profiling.
articles.title: Air India crash death toll hits 270, families wait for bodies

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian forces have stopped Russian troops advancing in the northeastern Sumy region and are now battling along the border to regain control, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said.
articles.title: Zelenskiy says Ukraine halts Russian troops' advance in Sumy region

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain is moving additional military assets, including fighter jets, to the Middle East to provide support across the region, Prime Minister Keir Starmer told reporters on Saturday as he was en route to a Group of Seven meeting in Canada.
articles.title: Britain moving jets to Middle East to support regional security, PM Starmer says

articles.author: Muvija M
articles.description: Rajrajeshwar Guruji, head of the Siddhashram Hindu temple in Harrow, likened the grief of those who lost family members to the wait for a loved one's return from an endless journey.
articles.title: 'In shock': British Indians mourn crash victims at London vigil

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli fire and airstrikes killed at least 23 Palestinians across the Gaza Strip, most of them near an aid distribution site operated by the U.S.-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation, local health authorities said.
articles.title: Israeli fire kills 23 people in Gaza, many at aid site, medics say
